_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
1/7/26:  3:00 PM Update: : Southback is now open. Northway, Gold Hills, Quicksilver will remain closed today.
Good afternoon Crystal Mountain! It's all deep turns and full-on face shots, all day long, and refills are on the way with snowfall turning back on this afternoon. With that said, please ski and ride with caution. Todays snow was deep and light which means deep snow and tree well immersion risk is high, especially in trees and tighter zones. Stick with your buddy, keep each other in sight at all times, and regroup often. This Winter Storm Warning continued through tomorrow, so the good are forecast to keep coming, with chances of sunshine Friday and into the weekend.

The first $62 Thursday is on tomorrow! We'll see you up for another great day! 

Snow depth personally verified, and report written from ground level by Emmy, the avy dog  

Join us January 11th for the Calling Women In: Ski Patrol Seminar! Women will experience the highlight reel of patrolling from the perspective of female patrollers. Registration required: MORE INFO + REGISTRATION

Notes for today:
  1. Snowfall totals are updated daily at 5am. 
  2. For everyone's safety, sledding is not permitted in our operating area. 
  3. Ski & ride with care. We know youre excited, and we are too. Please ride responsibly and stay in control, especially in high traffic areas. Respect all closures. Take a moment to read more on our Mountain Safety page!
  4. Book your shuttle today! The Crystal Express Shuttle is free with a reservation, and runs on weekends and holidays, with multiple departures from the Enumclaw Expo Center Parking Lot. 
  5. Parking Reservation cancellations are always required if you're not planning on making it up. This includes for advanced bookings and additions from the waitlist. No-show policy applies. Do your part to ensure everyone has access to the mountain. Thank you!
  6. At this time, paid reservations can only be cancelled by emailing SP+ at  CrystalMtnParking@spplus.com with Reservation #, First Name, and Last Name. While you may not receive an immediate reply, the cancellation will be processed. The Crystal Mountain Contact center cannot process these cancellations. 
Jumpstart your new year with these new deals!  We're rolling back the pricing on the Anytime and Mid-week 3-day Passes. Ski for as low as $73 a day! No code needed- but hurry, this deal ends on January 11th. Then, on January 6th, we kick off a full month celebration of our founding year, 1962, with $62 now every Tuesday and Thursday through the end of the month.

FOOD+BEVERAGE Hours 1/7/26

Brew 62:  7:00am-4pm
MCL Food Hall:  7:00am-10:30am for Grab+Go, Hot Line Open 10:30am-4pm
Bootpack Bar: 10:30am-5pm
Summit House: 10:30am-2:30pm (last seating)
Midway Yurt: 11am-4pm (Brown Bag Space)
Campbell Basin Lodge:   10:30am-3pm (Bathrooms and Grab+Go at 9am)
Rafters: Warming Loft only
Quickstop Yurt:  Closed
Tower 16:   Closed
Fireside Cantina:  Closed


Uphill Travel Update: See the above banner for the current status. Uphill travel is no longer permitted into Southback for the remainder of the season. Please visit guest services to get your 25/26 uphill travel card, this must be renewed free of charge for the season. Uphill travel may be prohibited at any time as mountain operations teams conduct avalanche mitigation. Refer to the "No Uphill Travel" lights around the base area and the Mountain Report page indicating the status of the designated route. These lights are located by the Gondola trail map, bottom of Chinook, bottom of Discovery, and top of Quicksilver lift shack. For more information about uphill travel, please visit the uphill travel page. 
 
Mountain Weather 1/7/2026 4:20pm
Forecaster: Chris Pleasance

Synopsis: After being pounded by back-to-back systems and coated by a healthy amount of the white stuff were entering a milder, yet still wintry period to close out the week. The brunt of Mother Natures snowy assault has passed, but well remain in cool NW flow with intermittent showers for yet another day. The winds may get cranky again, but nothing more than weve become accustomed to over the past couple of days. 
 
Wednesday Night:  
Sky Cover: Cloudy w/ Snow Showers
Freezing Elevation: 1000  
12hr Precip: 0.25"we with 2-4" snow  
Wind Trends: Moderate increasing to Strong W
Thursday: 
Sky Cover: Cloudy w/ Snow Showers
Freezing Elevation: 1500 
12hr Precip: Less than 0.25we with 1-3" snow  
Wind Trends: Strong W
Thursday Night:  
Sky Cover: Cloudy
Freezing Elevation: 2500 
12hr Precip: Trace
Wind Trends: Decreasing to Moderate WSW 
 
Outlook: As the week comes to a close, so does our dance with the snow gods. Well see temps steadily rise into the weekend and precipitation dry up. At the tail end of this weekends warm up, the models are flirting with a rude slap of warm moisture - so enjoy the goods weve got! Mother Nature loves to remind us that we still ski in Washington.
 



UPCOMING EVENTS:

Jan 6: Treasure Hunt Tuesday | All Day: Don't miss out on the adventure! Grab your gear and join us for Treasure Hunt Tuesdays!

Jan 11: Calling Women In: Ski Patrol Seminar | 7:30am-5pm: Join us for SheJumps: Calling Women In Ski Patrol! Women will experience the highlight reel of patrolling from the perspective of female patrollers. Registration required!

Jan 15: Military Appreciation Day | All Day

Jan 15: Intro to Backcountry Touring Clinic | 9am-1pm

Jan 16-18: AIARE Course 1 | All Day

Jan 17: Birds of Prey Summit Aprs | 3pm-5pm: Join us at the Summit House for panoramic views, aprs delights and unforgettable up-close encounters with Birds of Prey.

Jan 17: Chinese New Year Treasure Hunt | All Day



SPECIAL OPERATIONS UPDATE: RETURN TO REGULAR OPERATIONS


  • We have returned to our regular parking plan, with parking reservations required Friday 12/26 to 1/4 during the holiday period and onwards on weekend/Holidays.
  • Parking arrivals after 12 p.m. noon without a parking reservation are now permitted.  
  • Parking on days without reservation requirements and for arrivals after 12 p.m. noon are on a first come, first served basis.  
  • Guests on the parking waitlist for regularly required reservation days have been added to confirmed reservation, if space is available on the given day.  Guests still on the wait list will be notified if spaces become available.  System errors have been corrected, apologies and thank you to those who helped flag the glitches.  
  • Parking reservation refunds will go out for all of the previously required midweek days that were booked during our interim parking plan. Refunds may take 7-10 business to appear in your account. No action is needed for this refund. 
  • To cancel advanced purchase of reservations email: CrystalMtnParking@spplus.com with Reservation #, First Name, and Last Name. Additional follow-up with some accounts may apply. Note: the Crystal Mountain Contact Center cannot cancel reservations.  
  • For up to the date information on Highway 410, please visit the WSDOT website.


25/26 WINTER PRODUCTS & PASSES

  • NIGHT SKIING HAS BEEN EXTENDED FOR THE 25/26 SEASON! FROM 28 to 53 NIGHTS! Read full announcement 
  • Daily lift tickets are now on sale, plus $62 Tuesday's are NOW DOUBLED! Every 2nd and now 4th Tuesday of the 25/26 season, ride for only $62! Lock in your holiday plans, or your next trip with savings you can't beat. Purchase now and save later.
  • Performance Ski, Snowboard and Beginner Rental Pass: ON SALE NOW! 
  • Tune Pass: Premier and Base available for purchase!
  • Demo Pass: Lock in the best gear of the 25/26 season with unlimited use!
  • 25/26 3-Day Midweek & Anytime Passes: Your pass to the perfect powder day, groomer day or when conditions are right for you. Purchase today and gear up for a rad winter.
  • Afternoon Pass: With extended night skiing dates, take your Afternoon Pass to the next level!

25/26 WINTER PROGRAMS,CLINICS, AND NECESSITIES

  • Ski and Ride School: Explore our programs and find your right fit.
  • Freeride Program (NEW! Adult Programs now available): Registration now open, limited spots available! 
  • AIARE Course & Certification: Ski the backcountry with expert knowledge and certification
  • Seasonal Gear storage: Hassle-free on mountain storage with limited availability, lock your space in today!
  • Seasonal Lockers: For you or the entire family, check out options today .
  • Full Day Seasonal Lesson Programs for 4-6 year olds are now available- with lunch included too!   
  • Secure your spot. Already signed up for a 2-hour session and want to upgrade? No problemjust call us at 833-279-7895

In case of on-mountain emergency: Call 360-663-3064 or 911

_inspectorSnowReport.Alert:
1/7/26 1:13 PM: Southback is now open. Northway will remain closed today. 

Uphill Travel Status: Uphill travel is NOT permitted. Uphill Status is subject to closure at any time, and travelers must check Uphill Status lights before departure.

Snow Immersion Warning
Deep, unconsolidated snow conditions today create a high risk of snow immersion suffocation, especially in trees, steep terrain, and terrain traps. A fall into deep snow can make self-rescue extremely difficult and time is critical. Stay safe out there:
  • Always ski or ride with a partner in sight
  • Stop frequently and regroup
  • Avoid skiing alone in trees or deep features
  • If a partner goes down, respond immediately
  • Carry rescue gear and know how to use it
